LET.autocompleteDescription: Evaluates formula_expression using declared named arguments.

parameterDetails.content: One method of using this function is to provide a single sorted row or column search_range to look through for the search_key with a second argument result_range. The other way is to combine these two arguments into one search_result_array where the first row or column is searched and a value is returned from the last row or column in the array. If search_key is not found, a non-exact match may be returned.

parameterDetails.title: result_range - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: The range from which to return a result. The value returned corresponds to the location where search_key is found in search_range. This range must be only a single row or column and should not be used if using the search_result_array method.

Each such application produces an intermediate value which is accumulated in an accumulator. The logic to accumulate must be present in the formula_expression of the lambda. Returns the final result contained in the accumulator.

parameterDetails.title: initial_value
parameterDetails.content: The starting value for the accumulator.

parameterDetails.title: lambda
parameterDetails.content: A lambda that will be applied to each value in array_or_range for reducing it. The lambda must have exactly 2 name arguments along with a formula_expression which uses those names. The first name will resolve to the current result in the accumulator and the second name will resolve to the current value in array_or_range, when applying the lambda. The accumulator is updated in each step to the intermediate value obtained in the previous step.

SCAN.autocompleteDescription: Scans an array and produces intermediate values.
examples: SCAN(0, A1:C3, LAMBDA(cumulative, value, cumulative + value))
SCAN.aboutDetails: Scans array_or_range by repeatedly applying a lambda to each value in it, moving row by row. Each such application produces an intermediate value which is accumulated in an accumulator. The logic to accumulate must be present in the formula_expression of the lambda. Returns an array of the intermediate values obtained at each step.

parameterDetails.title: initial_value
parameterDetails.content: The starting value for the accumulator.

parameterDetails.title: array_or_range
parameterDetails.content: The array or range to be scanned.

parameterDetails.title: lambda
parameterDetails.content: A lambda that will be applied to each value in array_or_range for scanning it. The lambda must have exactly 2 name arguments along with a formula_expression which uses those names. The first name will resolve to the current value in the accumulator and the second name will resolve to the current value in array_or_range, when applying the lambda. The accumulator is updated in each step to the intermediate value obtained in the previous step.

SCAN.name: SCAN

TREND.autocompleteDescription: Fits points to linear trend derived via least-squares.
TREND.aboutDetails: Given partial data about a linear trend, fits an ideal linear trend using the least squares method and/or predicts further values.

parameterDetails.title: known_data_y
parameterDetails.content: The array or range containing dependent (y) values that are already known, used to curve fit an ideal linear trend.

parameterDetails.title: known_data_x - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: The values of the independent variable(s) corresponding with known_data_y.

parameterDetails.title: new_data_x - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: The data points to return the y values for on the ideal curve fit.

parameterDetails.title: b - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: Given a general linear form of y = m*x+b for a curve fit, calculates b if TRUE or forces b to be 0 and only calculates the m values if FALSE, i.e. forces the curve fit to pass through the origin.

parameterDetails.content: The first sample of data or group of cells to consider for the t-test.

parameterDetails.title: range2
parameterDetails.content: The second sample of data or group of cells to consider for the t-test.

parameterDetails.title: tails

parameterDetails.title: type

UMINUS.autocompleteDescription: A number with the sign reversed.

parameterDetails.content: The number to have its sign reversed. Equivalently, the number to multiply by -1.

UNIQUE.aboutDetails: Returns unique rows in the provided source range, discarding duplicates. Rows are returned in the order in which they first appear in the source range.

parameterDetails.title: range
parameterDetails.content: The data to filter by unique entries.

parameterDetails.title: by_column - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: Whether to filter the data by columns or by rows. By default, this is false.

parameterDetails.title: exactly_once - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: Whether to return only entries with no duplicates. By default, this is false.

UNIQUE.name: UNIQUE

parameterDetails.title: value
parameterDetails.content: The number to return.

UPPER.autocompleteDescription: Converts a specified string to uppercase.

parameterDetails.content: The string to convert to uppercase.

parameterDetails.content: The first value or range of the sample.

parameterDetails.content: Additional values or ranges to include in the sample.

parameterDetails.content: Additional values or ranges to include in the population.

VDB.aboutDetails: Returns the depreciation of an asset for a particular period (or partial period).

parameterDetails.title: cost
parameterDetails.content: Initial cost of the asset.

parameterDetails.title: salvage
parameterDetails.content: Value of the asset at the end of depreciation (salvage value).

parameterDetails.title: life
parameterDetails.content: Number of periods of depreciation (useful life of the asset)

parameterDetails.title: start_period
parameterDetails.content: Starting period to calculate depreciation.

parameterDetails.title: end_period
parameterDetails.content: Ending period to calculate depreciation.

parameterDetails.title: factor - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: Rate of balance decline (the default is 2: the double-declining balance method).

parameterDetails.title: no_switch - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: Whether to switch to straight-line depreciation when the depreciation is greater than the declining balance calculation.

VDB.name: VDB

VLOOKUP.aboutDetails: Vertical lookup. Searches down the first column of a range for a key and returns the value of a specified cell in the row found.

parameterDetails.title: search_key
parameterDetails.content: The value to search for. For example, 42, "Cats", or I24.

parameterDetails.title: range
parameterDetails.content: The range to consider for the search. The first column in the range is searched for the key specified in search_key.

parameterDetails.title: index
parameterDetails.content: The column index of the value to be returned, where the first column in range is numbered 1.

parameterDetails.title: is_sorted - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: Indicates whether the column to be searched (the first column of the specified range) is sorted, in which case the closest match for search_key will be returned.

parameterDetails.title: range2… - [optional] repeatable
parameterDetails.content: Additional ranges to add to range1.

parameterDetails.title: type - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: A number indicating which numbering system to use to represent weekdays. By default, counts starting with Sunday = 1.

parameterDetails.content: The scale parameter of the Weibull distribution function.

parameterDetails.content: Whether to use the cumulative distribution function.

parameterDetails.content: The input to the Weibull distribution function.

parameterDetails.title: shape
parameterDetails.content: The shape parameter of the Weibull distribution function.

parameterDetails.title: cumulative
parameterDetails.content: Whether to use the cumulative distribution function.

WORKDAY.aboutDetails: Calculates the date after a number of working days from a specified start date.

parameterDetails.title: num_days
parameterDetails.content: The number of working days to advance from start_date. If negative, counts backwards.

WORKDAY.INTL.aboutDetails: Calculates the date after a specified number of workdays excluding specified weekend days and holidays.

parameterDetails.title: num_days
parameterDetails.content: The number of working days to advance from start_date. If negative, counts backwards.

parameterDetails.title: weekend - [optional]

parameterDetails.title: holidays - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: A range or array constant containing the dates to consider holidays.

parameterDetails.content: The maximum number of cells for each column, rounded down to the nearest whole number.

parameterDetails.content: The value with which to fill the extra cells in the range. The default is #N/A.

WRAPCOLS.name: WRAPCOLS

WRAPROWS.aboutDetails: Wraps the provided row or column of cells by rows after a specified number of elements to form a new array.

parameterDetails.content: The maximum number of cells for each row, rounded down to the nearest whole number.

WRAPROWS.name: WRAPROWS

XIRR.autocompleteDescription: Internal rate of return given non-periodic cashflows.
XIRR.aboutDetails: Calculates the internal rate of return of an investment based on a specified series of potentially irregularly spaced cash flows.

parameterDetails.title: cashflow_amounts
parameterDetails.content: An array or range containing the income or payments associated with the investment.

parameterDetails.title: cashflow_dates
parameterDetails.content: An array or range with dates corresponding to the cash flows in cashflow_amounts.

parameterDetails.title: rate_guess - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: An estimate for what the internal rate of return will be.

XIRR.name: XIRR

XLOOKUP.autocompleteDescription: Returns the range at the position that matches a search value
XLOOKUP.aboutDetails: Cross lookup. Returns the values in the result range at the position where a match was found in the lookup range.

parameterDetails.title: search_key
parameterDetails.content: The value to search for. For example, 42, "Cats", or I24.

parameterDetails.title: lookup_range
parameterDetails.content: The range to consider for the search. This range must be a singular row or column.

parameterDetails.title: result_range
parameterDetails.content: The range to consider for the result. This range's row or column size should be the same as the lookup_range's, depending on how the lookup is done.

parameterDetails.title: missing_value - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: The value to return if no match is found. If unspecified, an error is returned.

parameterDetails.title: match_mode - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: How to find a match for the search_key. 0 is for an exact match, 1 for an exact match or the next value that is bigger than the search_key, -1 for an exact match or the next value that is lower than the search_key, and 2 for a wildcard match. If unspecified, this defaults to finding an exact match.

parameterDetails.title: search_mode - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: How to search through the lookup range. 1 is to search from the first entry to the last one, -1 to search from the last entry to the first, 2 to search through the range using binary search and assuming the range is sorted in ascending order, and -2 to search through the range using binary search and assuming the range is sorted in descending order. If unspecified, this defaults to searching through the range from the first entry to the last one.

XLOOKUP.name: XLOOKUP

XNPV.autocompleteDescription: Net present value given non-periodic cashflows.
XNPV.aboutDetails: Calculates the net present value of an investment based on a specified series of potentially irregularly spaced cash flows and a discount rate.

parameterDetails.title: discount
parameterDetails.content: The discount rate of the investment over one period.

parameterDetails.title: cashflow_amounts
parameterDetails.content: A range of cells containing the income or payments associated with the investment.

parameterDetails.title: cashflow_dates
parameterDetails.content: A range of cells with dates corresponding to the cash flows in cashflow_amounts.

XNPV.name: XNPV

XOR.aboutDetails: Returns true if an odd number of the provided arguments are logically true, and false if an even number of the arguments are logically true.

parameterDetails.title: logical_expression2… - [optional] repeatable
parameterDetails.content: More expressions that represent logical values.

XOR.name: XOR

YEAR.autocompleteDescription: Year specified by a given date.

YEARFRAC.aboutDetails: Returns the number of years, including fractional years, between two dates using a specified day count convention.

parameterDetails.title: start_date
parameterDetails.content: The start date to consider in the calculation. Must be a reference to a cell containing a date, a function returning a date type, or a number.

parameterDetails.title: end_date
parameterDetails.content: The end date to consider in the calculation. Must be a reference to a cell containing a date, a function returning a date type, or a number.

parameterDetails.title: day_count_convention - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: An indicator of what day count method to use.

YEARFRAC.name: YEARFRAC

YIELD.aboutDetails: Calculates the annual yield of a security paying periodic interest, such as a US Treasury Bond, based on price.

parameterDetails.title: settlement
parameterDetails.content: The settlement date of the security, the date after issuance when the security is delivered to the buyer.

parameterDetails.title: maturity
parameterDetails.content: The maturity or end date of the security, when it can be redeemed at face, or par value.

parameterDetails.title: rate
parameterDetails.content: The annualized rate of interest.

parameterDetails.title: price
parameterDetails.content: The price at which the security is bought per 100 face value.

parameterDetails.title: redemption
parameterDetails.content: The redemption amount per 100 face value, or par.

parameterDetails.title: frequency
parameterDetails.content: The number of interest or coupon payments per year (1, 2, or 4).

parameterDetails.title: day_count_convention - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: An indicator of what day count method to use.

YIELD.name: YIELD

YIELDDISC.autocompleteDescription: Annual yield of a discount security.
YIELDDISC.aboutDetails: Calculates the annual yield of a discount (non-interest-bearing) security, based on price.

parameterDetails.title: settlement
parameterDetails.content: The settlement date of the security, the date after issuance when the security is delivered to the buyer.

parameterDetails.title: maturity
parameterDetails.content: The maturity or end date of the security, when it can be redeemed at face, or par value.

parameterDetails.title: price
parameterDetails.content: The price at which the security is bought per 100 face value.

parameterDetails.title: redemption
parameterDetails.content: The redemption amount per 100 face value, or par.

parameterDetails.title: day_count_convention - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: An indicator of what day count method to use.

YIELDDISC.name: YIELDDISC

YIELDMAT.autocompleteDescription: Annual yield of a security paying interest at maturity.
YIELDMAT.aboutDetails: Calculates the annual yield of a security paying interest at maturity, based on price.

parameterDetails.title: settlement
parameterDetails.content: The settlement date of the security, the date after issuance when the security is delivered to the buyer.

parameterDetails.title: maturity
parameterDetails.content: The maturity or end date of the security, when it can be redeemed at face or par value.

parameterDetails.title: issue
parameterDetails.content: The date the security was initially issued.

parameterDetails.title: rate
parameterDetails.content: The annualized rate of interest.

parameterDetails.title: price
parameterDetails.content: The price at which the security is bought.

parameterDetails.title: day_count_convention - [optional]
parameterDetails.content: An indicator of what day count method to use.

YIELDMAT.name: YIELDMAT

ZTEST.aboutDetails: Returns the one-tailed p-value of a Z-test with standard distribution.

parameterDetails.title: data
parameterDetails.content: The array or range containing the dataset to consider.

parameterDetails.title: value
parameterDetails.content: The test statistic to use in the Z-test.
